question: Some people enjoy change and they look forward to new experiences. Others like their lives to remain the same and do not like any changes. What is your opinion as far as change in life is concerned?Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
text: Some want to change their environment and long for something new whereas others dislike such transition and hope for stabilized life. Personally, I am in favour of the opinion that seeking a shift has some positive influences on life since experiencing variation is an essential factor in the modern world in order to have success and be skilled in various genres.

In my opinion, I reckon that people who like to change the setting would like to learn many things from new places. When it comes to jobs, it is commonplace to experience various professions without  continuing identical works. Such workers hope to have new occupations so as to enhance their market values before more practical skills become able to be helpful in society. In fact, I have realized not only that I am a person who applies the ability to contribute to a spacious community but also the increase in assessment by others by being skilful in a variety of fields. Another positive influence the changing existing surroundings into novel ones is that you can be a more cosmopolitan person. For example, some students are keen to study abroad and thus be competent in different languages. This is because it is true that learning a foreign language enables them to solve some challenging tasks and expand their possibility for the future. Actually, I believe that it is due to experience in a multitude of countries when I was a student for me to get success globally.

Focusing on the opinion of naysayers to change, in my view, I think that they tend to pursue stable surroundings. For instance, regarding the movent of their home, these people are apt not to move their dwelling which they have already assimilated  because the process of getting used to a brand-new community is not easy for some. In my experience, it was difficult for me who has experienced the movement from Ibaraki to Chiba to make friends in varied schools.

In conclusion, transition in the setting plays an important role in the success and enhancing yourself values though it is true that it takes tremendous time to become used to this new situation. In my view, changes have positive influences on the accomplishment of the future and are implemented to acquire beneficial skills. That is why I argue that experiencing some shifts is important.
